newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds end flat, 2003 global expanded.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds end flat, 2003 global expanded.

text.p: Argentine bonds finished flat to lower Monday as price action and activity ahead of U.S. economic indicator releases stayed thin.
"The market remains firm," said a trader at a local bank. "We are waiting for the U.S. numbers."
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 was flat at 95-1/4 while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 dipped $0.05 to 118.70.
U.S. Employment Cost Index figures will be released Tuesday followed by jobless figures Friday.
News late in the session that Argentina has expanded its 2003 global bond by $500 million, replacing the planned 2004 global to have been issued last week, had little impact on the market.
The $500 million expansion was priced at 185 basis points over similar dated U.S. Treasuries.
Otherwise, another trader said the market remained buoyed by the credit rating assigned to Ecuador's foreign debt by Moody's last week.
Since the rating of B1 put Ecuador at the same level as Argentina and Brazil, the market is expecting an upgrade of Argentina by Moody's, the trader said.
In the money markets, three-month peso BAIBOR rates fell to 6.75 percent from 7.0 percent.
